_comment: PATTERN: Round-based conference. ICWSM has 3 submission rounds per year. Each round is a separate entry with a distinct name_display (includes round number) but the SAME name_full. The event_dates, city, country, link, topics, and archival status are identical across rounds. Only the deadline and notes differ.

_entries.name_full: International AAAI Conference on Web and Social Media 2026 - Full Papers
_entries.notes: New submissions and revise-and-resubmits (R&Rs) from January 2025 round. Double-blind review; AAAI two-column US-Letter format; 8-11 pp (up to 12 pp for camera-ready). Ethics Checklist required.

_entries.name_full: International AAAI Conference on Web and Social Media 2026 - Full Papers
_entries.notes: New submissions and R&Rs from May 2025 round. Same formatting and ethics requirements as Round 1.

_entries.name_full: International AAAI Conference on Web and Social Media 2026 - Full Papers
_entries.notes: New submissions and R&Rs from September 2025 round. Accepted papers will appear at ICWSM 2026.

_comment: PATTERN: Multi-track with abstract+paper split. The Web Conference has separate entries for abstracts and papers within each track, plus workshops and tutorials. The name_display stays the same across all entries. The name_full uses parenthetical suffixes to distinguish: (Research Track: Abstracts Due), (Research Track: Papers Due), (Industry Track: Abstracts Due), etc. Note the abstract deadline always precedes the paper deadline by about a week.

_entries.name_full: The Web Conference 2026 (Research Track: Abstracts Due)
_entries.notes: Full paper abstracts. Double-blind review with rebuttal (Nov 24-Dec 1); notification on 2026-01-13; camera-ready due 2026-01-25. Max 8 pages (excl. references).

_entries.name_full: The Web Conference 2026 (Research Track: Papers Due)
_entries.notes: Full papers. Double-blind review with rebuttal (Nov 24-Dec 1); notification on 2026-01-13; camera-ready due 2026-01-25. Max 8 pages (excl. references).

_comment: PATTERN: Single-track abstract→paper pipeline. COLM requires authors to submit an abstract first, then the full paper a few days later. These are sequential stages of the SAME submission — not separate tracks. Use submission_stage: 'Abstract' and submission_stage: 'Full paper' on two otherwise-identical entries. The name_display and name_full are the same on both (no parenthetical suffixes). The site automatically groups them into a single card showing both deadlines. DO NOT use this pattern for multi-track conferences like CHI or The Web Conference — use name_full parentheticals for those instead.

_entries.notes: Abstract submission deadline. Max 9 pages main text. Rebuttal May 22-June 8. Notification July 8. Max 25 submissions per person. Double-blind via OpenReview.
Full paper deadline. At Hilton Union Square. LLM usage disclosure required. Per-submission reciprocal reviewing. Dual submission with other archival venues prohibited during review.

_comment: PATTERN: Simple conference with tutorials + abstracts. IC2S2 has just two entry types: Tutorials and Abstracts. Both share the same name_display and name_full. They differ only in submission_type, deadline, and notes. This is the simplest multi-entry pattern.

_entries.name_full: International Conference on Computational Social Science
_entries.notes: Tutorial day is July 28. Acceptance notifications by February 16, 2026. Tutorials aimed at early-career scholars.

_entries.name_full: International Conference on Computational Social Science
_entries.notes: Max 2-page extended abstract (PDF), anonymized for double-blind review. Figures/tables do not count toward page limit.
